abstract: In a win for Potash Corp. in its effort to fend off BHP Billiton’s $39 billion hostile takeover bid, a U.S. federal judge said on Monday he would allow the discovery process to proceed in a lawsuit filed by world’s largest producer of potash against its unwanted suitor.
snippet: In a win for Potash Corp. in its effort to fend off BHP Billiton’s $39 billion hostile takeover bid, a U.S. federal judge said on Monday he would allow the discovery process to proceed in a lawsuit filed by world’s largest producer of potash again...
lead_paragraph: A U.S. federal judge said on Monday he would allow the discovery process to proceed in a lawsuit filed by Potash Corp. to fend off BHP Billiton‘s $39 billion hostile takeover bid.

headline.main: Potash Corp.’s Suit Against BHP Allowed to Proceed

abstract: The Deal Professor examines Potash’s options after BHP Billiton extended its $39 billion hostile offer for the company by 30 days.
snippet: The Deal Professor examines Potash’s options after BHP Billiton extended its $39 billion hostile offer for the company by 30 days.
lead_paragraph: BHP Billiton’s $39 billion bid for the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan is one of the biggest deals of the year, if not the biggest. It has it all: a hostile bidder, a hot commodity, an international dimension, national security issues and the potential for banker fees galore.

headline.main: As BHP Waits, the Next Steps for Potash
